event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A serious undervoltage failure has occurred on a device or FRU.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A serious undervoltage failure has occurred on a device or FRU.

The FRU or device with the undervoltage failure
can be identified from the FMRI of the fault report.

The following section provides a list of the potential FRUs and devices
that can encounter an undervoltage failure, and specifies the impact and
automated actions taken by the platform or domain in response to the fault.

 
  SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:


      Fan Backplane (FANBP_B):
      Motherboard Unit (MBU):

         Platform is powered off and cannot be powered back up.
         Platform is unbootable.


   SPARC Enterprise M4000/M5000 platforms:


      DDC on a Fan Backplane (FANBP_B):
      DDC on a Fan Backplane (FANBP_C):

         Fans may be faulted.
         Onboard storage (disk) may be powered off or show no indicator LEDs.

      DDC_A on a Motherboard:
      DDC_A on an IOU:
      DDC_B on a Motherboard:
      DDC_B on DDC Riser of an IO Unit (IOU):
      DDC Riser on an IOU:
      IO Unit (IOU):

         Platform is powered off and cannot be powered back up.
         Platform is unbootable.


      Memory Board (MEMB):
 
         Memory Board is powered off and all domains using this Memory Board are reset.
         Memory Board is is deconfigured.


      CPU Module (CPUM):

         CPU Module is powered off and all domains using the CPU Module are reset.
         CPU Module is deconfigured.




   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:


      DDC_A on a Backplane (BP_A):
         
         If there remain sufficient operational DDC_A's, then the DDC_A is deconfigured.
         Otherwise, the platform is powered off and cannot be powered back up.


      Backplane (BP_A):

         Platform is powered off and cannot be powered back up.
         Platform is unbootable.


      IO Unit (IOU):
 
         IOU is powered off and all domains using the IOU are reset.
         IOU is deconfigured.


      CPU Module (CPUM):

         CPU Module is powered off and a single domain is reset.
         CPU Module is deconfigured.


      CPU/Memory Unit (CMU):

         CMU is powered down and all domains using the CMU are reset.
         CMU is deconfigured.


      Crossbay Unit (XBU):

         Crossbar Unit (XBU) is powered down and the entire platform is reset.
         Crossbar way is deconfigured.

            If this is the first crossbar way being deconfigured,
            then the platform will operate with reduced performance.

            If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured,
            then the platform will be powered down.


      Clock Unit (CLKU):

         Clock Unit is powered down.
         Clock Unit is deconfigured.

            If this is the active Clock Unit, then the entire platform is reset.
            Otherwise, no action is taken.


      Switch Backplane (SWBP):
      Media Backplane (MEDBP):
      DVD Unit (DVDU):
      Tape Unit (TAPEU):
 
         Switch Backplane is deconfigured.
         This means the DAT and DVD drives are no longer available.



The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the Fault Message  (two methods)


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 15:19:33 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: 316abc6f-4635-4c4a-880a-a9b646c79cc8
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8004-EC for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8004-EC, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 15:19:33 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 316abc6f-4635-4c4a-880a-a9b646c79cc8
   DESC: A serious undervoltage failure has occurred on a device or FRU.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8004-EC for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The device or FRU will be deconfigured. Please consult the detail section of the
   knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: Domains may be reset, platform may become unbootable, or the platform may be powered down.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump  -v  -u  <Event-ID>' command
 


   SPARC Enterprise platform example:

   xscf> fmdump -v -u 316abc6f-4635-4c4a-880a-a9b646c79cc8

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 27 15:19:33.6462 316abc6f-4635-4c4a-880a-a9b646c79cc8 SCF-8004-EC
           100%  fault.chassis.power.undervoltage

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/cpum=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/cpum=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                             server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:serial=PP0640S689:
                             part=CA06620-D021 A6:revision=0201/component=/CMU#0/CPUM#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Domains may be reset, platform may become unbootable, or the platform may be powered down. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The device or FRU will be deconfigured. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Serious undervoltage failure from a device or FRU.
